Gateway#

A asynccore.gateway.gateway is responsible for all communication with the discord gateway#

class asynccore.gateway.gateway.Gateway(client, gateway_url, activity)[source]#

Bases: object

The gateway class is responsible for connecting all users to the discord’s gateway.

Parameters:

  • client (Client) – Library main client

  • gateway_url (str) – gateway_url to connect to the discord gateway

  • activity (Optional[ActivityBuilder]) – Set the activity of the user

event(**kwargs)[source]#
run(reconnect=False)[source]#

Main method of the class. Starts the users’ gateways

Parameters:

reconnect (bool) – Determine if the user should reconnect to the server or not

class asynccore.gateway.gateway.GatewayConnection(client, user, gateway, activity, reconnect)[source]#

Bases: object

GatewayConnection is responsible for communication between the discord gateway and the user

Parameters:

  • client (Client) – Store the client object in the gateway connection

  • user (UserClient) – Store the user object in the gateway connection,

  • gateway (Gateway) – Create a new gateway connection

  • activity (Optional[ActivityBuilder]) – Set the activity of the user

  • reconnect (bool) – Determine whether the userx should reconnect or not

await application_update_request(request, func, limit=None)[source]#

The application_update_request function is a coroutine that takes in a request and function. The request is put into the queue, and the function is set to be called when it’s time to process the request.

Parameters:

  • request (dict) – Pass the request to the application_update_request function

  • func (Callable) – Store the function that will be called when a response is received

  • limit (int | None) –

Note

This is mainly used for .search_slash_commands method

await begin_presence()[source]#

The begin_presence function is used to send the initial presence payload to Discord. This function is called when the client connects and has received a READY payload from Discord. The begin_presence function will only be called if an activity was set on the client before connecting.

property get_headers: dict#

The get_headers function returns a dictionary of headers that are used to make the request.

await login()[source]#

The login function is used to send the login request to Discord. It takes no arguments, and returns nothing.

Return type:

None

await resume()[source]#

The resume function is used to resume a connection that has been closed. It will attempt to reconnect every second until the websocket is open again.

await resume_connection()[source]#

The resume_connection function is used to resume a connection with the Discord Gateway. It does this by sending a RESUME payload to the gateway.

await run(gateway_url)[source]#

The run function is the main function of the Gateway class. It connects to a gateway, and then creates three tasks:

  1. Receiving responses from Discord (self._receive_response())

  2. Sending requests to Discord (self._send_request())

  3. Pinging Discord every x seconds (self._ping_loop())

Parameters:

gateway_url (str) – url to connect

Return type:

None

await send(request)[source]#

The send function is a coroutine that takes in a request and puts it into the queue.

asynccore.gateway.gateway.parametrized(decorator)[source]#
